result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly M Fromm

records.addlTxt: 03:33 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kimberly M Fromm in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Miller advises her client is prepared to proceed with plea and sentencing today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Miller confirms the offer.  Pursuant to the offer the Court orders this case dismissed and read into 21CM2139.  Court orders the $2,000.00 be applied to the Court costs in 21CM2139 & 22CM553; any remaining amount to be refunded to the poster.
Return of Criminal Complaint - Defendant has been released from the Waukesha County Jail

ADDRESS INFO for Kimberly M Fromm
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha Co Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-08-2022)
Prior: 3675 Mountain Dr, Brookfield, WI 53045

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

01:12 PM Defendant Kimberly M Fromm in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hughes appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
